com.ibm.aglets.thread
Class DeliveryMessageThread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      com.ibm.aglets.thread.DeliveryMessageThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class DeliveryMessageThread
extends java.lang.Thread

The aim of this class is to provide a thread specialized for sending messages, so that the main thread of an agent can order to this thread to send messages while continuining doing something else. The thread created waits until a new message (and an addressee proxy) is provided, and then delivers the message. Please note that until a deliver message method is invoked, this thread will stay waiting. Once the message has been delivered, the thread stays waiting again for a new message. In this way you can reuse this thread for several messages.

Version:
1.0 6/10/2005
Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net

Constructor Detail

DeliveryMessageThread

public DeliveryMessageThread(AgletProxy p,
                             Message msg)
Constructs the thread. It does not start the thread! This means you have to manually deliver the message thru the deliverMessage method.

Parameters:
p - the proxy of the agent to use for this thread.
msg - the message to delivery thru the proxy.

DeliveryMessageThread

public DeliveryMessageThread(AgletProxy p,
                             Message msg,
                             boolean deliveryImmediatly)
Builds the delivery message and delivers immediatly the message if specified.

Parameters:
p - the proxy to which the message has to be sent
msg - the message to send
deliveryImmediatly - true if the message must be delivered immediatly

deliverMessage

public final void deliverMessage(AgletProxy p,
                                 Message m,
                                 boolean deliverNow)
Deliver a specific message to the specific agent.

Parameters:
p - the proxy of the agent to deliver to
m - the message to deliver.
deliverNow - true if the message must be delivered immediatly, false if the message must wait until deliverMessage is called on this thread.
